programme.title: Shrek Forever After
programme.desc: After Rumpelstiltskin tricks him into making a pact, Shrek (Mike Myers) finds himself in an alternate version of Far Far Away, in which he and Fiona never met.

programme.title: The Suicide Squad
programme.desc: The government sends the most dangerous supervillains in the world to the remote, enemy-infused island of Corto Maltese. Armed with high-tech weapons, they trek through the dangerous jungle on a search-and-destroy mission with Col. Rick Flag.

programme.title: Lewis Black: Black on Broadway
programme.desc: Lewis Black performs material from his "Rules of Engagement" tour at the Brooks Atkinson Theater in New York City.

programme.title: Martin Lawrence: You So Crazy
programme.desc: Martin Lawrence performs his stand-up comedy routine in a concert recorded at Brooklyn's Majestic Theatre.

programme.title: Jerrod Carmichael: Don't Be Gay
programme.desc: Emmy-winning comedian Jerrod Carmichael takes to the stage for his latest comedy special, bringing his signature blend of unbridled honesty, emotional gut punches and sharp, dry wit.

programme.title: Jerrod Carmichael: 8
programme.desc: The comic discusses Donald Trump's presidential victory, climate change, animal rights and other topics in his second solo special taped in the round at the Masonic Hall in New York.

programme.title: The Princess Bride
programme.desc: A storybook stableboy turns pirate (Cary Elwes) and rescues his beloved (Robin Wright), who is about to marry a dreadful prince.

programme.title: The Pentagon Wars
programme.desc: Col. James G. Burton (Cary Elwes) protests government waste and poor decisions in the development of a troop carrier.

programme.title: Glee the 3D Concert Movie
programme.desc: Highlights of the "Glee" cast (Dianna Agron, Chris Colfer, Darren Criss) summer 2011 concert tour feature songs "Raise Your Glass," "Teenage Dream" and other songs.

programme.title: Life Partners
programme.desc: A 29-year-old lawyer (Gillian Jacobs) and her lesbian best friend (Leighton Meester) experience a dramatic shift in their longtime bond after one enters a serious relationship.

programme.title: The Nut Job 2: Nutty by Nature
programme.desc: Surly the squirrel and his animal pals find out that the corrupt mayor of Oakton plans to bulldoze their beloved park. Hoping to save the place they call home, the gang joins forces with a cute mouse who happens to be a fierce master of kung fu.

programme.title: Goodrich
programme.desc: Andy's life gets upended when his wife enters a 90-day rehab program, leaving him in charge of their twins. With his career falling by the wayside, he soon leans on his pregnant daughter for support, ultimately becoming the father she never had.

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: An attractive lawyer and Bridget's (RenÃ©e Zellweger) former boss (Hugh Grant) threaten her newfound happiness with Mark Darcy (Colin Firth).

programme.title: Bill Maher: The Decider
programme.desc: The comic performs at the Berklee Performance Center in Boston.

programme.title: Bill Maher: Is Anyone Else Seeing This?
programme.desc: Comedian Bill Maher addresses societal issues and taboo topics in their stand-up routine, pushing boundaries while aiming to resonate with a large audience.

programme.title: Marc Maron: From Bleak to Dark
programme.desc: From New York City's Town Hall, Marc Maron explores getting older, antisemitism and faith and the superiority of having cats over children; he opens up about the loss of his partner in 2020 and reestablishing his relationship with his father.

programme.title: Wonka
programme.desc: Armed with nothing but a hatful of dreams, young chocolatier Willy Wonka manages to change the world, one delectable bite at a time.

programme.title: Funny People
programme.desc: A gravely ill comic (Adam Sandler) takes a struggling performer (Seth Rogen) under his wing, then gets a chance to re-evaluate his life when his disease goes into remission.

programme.title: The Hangover
programme.desc: After a wild stag party in Las Vegas, three hazy groomsmen (Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis) must find their missing friend and get him back to Los Angeles in time for his wedding.

programme.title: Jerry Garcia: It's Not My Weekend
programme.desc: Rising comedian and single father Jerry Garcia makes fun of himself, his parenting style, and his dating life.

programme.title: Chris Rock: Kill the Messenger
programme.desc: The comic performs at South Africa's Carnival City Casino, the Apollo Theatre in New York and the Carling Apollo Hammersmith in London.

programme.title: James Acaster: Hecklers Welcome
programme.desc: James Acaster gives up control of his set and embraces audience participation as he explores his complex relationship with stand-up.

programme.desc: The comedian skewers current events and societal follies at a performance in Las Vegas.

programme.desc: Students at Philadelphia's Hill-Freedman World Academy work with local musicians to create an album of powerful, original songs that captures both the challenging times they're living in and the joy that music brings.

programme.title: We Bought a Zoo
programme.desc: A widower (Matt Damon) relocates his family to a dilapidated zoo and, with the help of its eclectic staff, works to restore the facility to its former glory.

programme.title: The Hobbit
programme.desc: An animated adaptation of J.R.R. Tolkien's tale of the adventures of a hobbit on a quest to regain a dwarf king's gold.

programme.title: Experimenter
programme.desc: In 1961, social psychologist Stanley Milgram (Peter Sarsgaard) conducts controversial experiments designed to measure conformity, conscience and free will.

programme.title: Prancer: A Christmas Tale
programme.desc: Ten-year-old Gloria and her grandfather Bud befriend a mysterious reindeer when the family gathers for Christmas. Bud comes to believe that Prancer may actually be magical, but Gloria fears his theory will send him straight to a retirement home.

programme.title: Monte Carlo
programme.desc: A case of mistaken identity turns a trip to Europe into the adventure of a lifetime for a teen (Selena Gomez), her stepsister (Leighton Meester) and her best friend (Katie Cassidy).

programme.title: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug
programme.desc: The dwarves, along with Bilbo Baggins and Gandalf the Grey, continue their quest to reclaim Erebor, their homeland, from Smaug. Bilbo Baggins is in possession of a mysterious and magical ring.

programme.title: Toni Morrison: The Pieces I Am
programme.desc: Author Toni Morrison leads an assembly of her peers, critics and colleagues on an exploration of race, history, America and the human condition.

programme.title: Spy Kids 2: The Island of Lost Dreams
programme.desc: A young sister (Alexa Vega) and brother encounter mutants and a wild scientist while searching for a device that could destroy Earth.

programme.title: Casino
programme.desc: A New York bookie (Robert De Niro) and his pal (Joe Pesci) turn a Las Vegas casino into an empire, then one's money-hungry wife (Sharon Stone) helps bring it down.

programme.title: The Gilded Age
programme.desc: A wide-eyed young scion of a conservative family embarks on a mission to infiltrate the wealthy neighboring clan dominated by ruthless railroad tycoon George Russell, his rakish son, Larry, and his ambitious wife, Bertha.

programme.title: Child's Play
programme.desc: Young Andy receives a special present from his mom -- a seemingly innocent Buddi doll that becomes his best friend. When the doll suddenly takes on a life of its own, Andy unites with other kids to stop the sinister toy from wreaking bloody havoc.

programme.title: Evil Dead Rise
programme.desc: A reunion between two estranged sisters gets cut short by the rise of flesh-possessing demons, thrusting them into a primal battle for survival as they face the most nightmarish version of family imaginable.

programme.title: Scanners
programme.desc: A scientist (Patrick McGoohan) sends a "scanner" (Stephen Lack) to hunt others like him with explosive psychic powers.

programme.title: Reframed: Next Gen Narratives
programme.desc: Clover must leave her family behind to compete in an algorithm-based singing competition; pressure from the judges leads Clover to doubt herself, but her family's words give her the strength to perform.

programme.title: Rizo
programme.desc: An Afro Latina struggles with her identity as she navigates the Hollywood machine.

programme.title: Money Electric: The Bitcoin Mystery
programme.desc: The origins of bitcoin and the identity of its anonymous creator, Satoshi Nakamoto, remains a high-stakes mystery of technology and finance.

programme.title: MoviePass, MovieCrash
programme.desc: Exploring the company's founding and the implosion that occurred after outside investors took over, rendering the company bankrupt and under investigation.

programme.title: The Gilded Age
programme.desc: A wide-eyed young scion of a conservative family embarks on a mission to infiltrate the wealthy neighboring clan dominated by ruthless railroad tycoon George Russell, his rakish son, Larry, and his ambitious wife, Bertha.

programme.title: Supergirl
programme.desc: Kara (Helen Slater) of Argo City poses as Clark Kent's cousin, Linda Lee, to recover the Omegahedron from a witch (Faye Dunaway).

programme.title: Superman
programme.desc: Jor-El (Marlon Brando) of Krypton sends his baby to Earth, where he grows up as Clark Kent (Christopher Reeve) and works at the Daily Planet.

programme.title: Superman II
programme.desc: The Man of Steel (Christopher Reeve) gets serious with Lois Lane (Margot Kidder) and fights three Krypton outcasts in league with Lex Luthor (Gene Hackman).

programme.title: Superman III
programme.desc: Ersatz kryptonite laced with tobacco tar splits Superman (Christopher Reeve) in two: good Clark Kent and bad Man of Steel.

programme.title: Superman IV: The Quest for Peace
programme.desc: The Man of Steel (Christopher Reeve) crusades for nuclear disarmament and meets Lex Luthor's (Gene Hackman) latest creation, Nuclear Man.

programme.title: Superman Returns
programme.desc: While Lex Luthor plots against him, the Man of Steel tries to reconnect with Lois Lane and find his place in a world that learned to survive in his absence.

programme.title: Man of Steel
programme.desc: Though struggling with the ramifications of his extraordinary origin and abilities, young Clark Kent (Henry Cavill) must become a hero and save those he loves from a dire threat.

programme.title: I Love You Forever
programme.desc: Following a young woman into and out of an emotionally abusive relationship.

programme.title: Cleaner
programme.desc: Radical activists take 300 hostages at an energy company's annual gala in a high-rise building. It's now up to a former soldier who works as a window cleaner to save the hostages trapped inside, including her younger brother.
